tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
title: I know Places
body:
You stand with a hand on my waistline

Good to see that we’re out in blank side

I can hear them whisper as we pass by

It’s a bad sign, bad sign

Sansa and you held one another while you walk among the crowd.

“Ignore them Sansa”, her body shakes. You feel her grip tightens as a group of women whisper from beside. “Lady Stark will be married to the imp”, one of the ladies spoke in a low voice. Sansa held her head high but you had yours down.

You went up the stairs away from the garden and the people.

Walking through for her to say her prayers.  

Something happens when everybody finds out

See the vulture circling in dark cloud

Love’s a fragile little flame, it could burn out

It could burn out

Cause they got the cages, they got the boxes

And guns, they are the hunters, we are the foxes

And we run

“You seem quite close to lady Stark”, you were midway drinking the wine but settled the cup on the table.

Tyrion Lannister; there he stands. A man who came from the family that raged war to your lady’s. The man who she married and will have the purpose to birth his child. You hated the Lannisters but Tyrion wasn’t easily hated however you didn’t like him either. A dwarf he is-meaning that he’s been ashamed for it his whole life maybe that’s why you don’t hate him as much.

You stand up in a hurry.

“My lord”, you bow to him but Tyrion gives a smile and dismisses it. You sit down-nervous on why he wants to talk to you. “You haven’t answered my question”, you frown slightly.

“What question? You haven’t asked one”. You cringe at the way you sounded and slightly afraid of what he’ll say but Tyrion doesn’t show any slight of annoyance just amusement. “Your relation with Sansa”, you’re tense and on the edge. Tyrion seems to sense something but maybe it just you being anxious as always.

“I have been her handmaiden for a long time”, Tyrion takes a seat next to you. You sigh thinking that you are stuck having to hold a conversation. Tyrion hands a motion for the servant to get him a drink. “Why are you here my lord?” Tyrion fidgets his fingers; “I was wondering if I could earn her trust…in a way”.

Raising your brow at his question to say you’re surprised. Tyrion’s drink is received as you sit up. You gulp your drink then answered him, “Sansa…used to like a lot of things that girls..her age would”. Tyrion nods in acknowledgment having an ear, “Does she still likes them?”

You coughed a laugh, “She did until Joffrey came around”. It took you a moment to become aware of what you said. “I’m sorry sir! I didn’t mean to insult the king or…”. Tyrion dismisses it with a hand, “Joffrey has known to destroy everything he touches”. Your body relaxes-Tyrion isn’t so bad like he seems but you had your guards up but.

Tyrion wasn’t as bad that’s something you would have to admit, In fact you enjoy his company.

People were judging you because you laughed loudly. Tyrion tells another story of him and his whores while you drank. “And then I vomited all over her”, the wine spits out of your mouth. Tyrion slightly backs away but laughs and you did the same.

Leveling your hand to your chin to catch any wine that spilled-Tyrion grabs you a cloth which you wiped with.

Sansa comes storming over, it seems she had a chance of meeting Joffrey along the way. “I want to leave”. Obvious to everyone she seems distressed and close to tears. You stand up, saying goodbye to Tyrion who wishes you a good day.

Baby I know places we won’t be found and they’ll be

Chasing their tails tryin’ to track us down

Cause I, I know places we can hide, I know places

I know places

Walking to her chamber; she rushes in the room. Sansa lets herself fall to to the bed and sobs.

You close the door approaching the bed and laying next to her.

“Sansa”, you call out for her in a low voice. She responds by burying her head on your shoulder.

“Was it Joffrey?” She shakes her head; “It’s everyone”. Her head rises-you see the tears sticking to her face; some of her hair strands glued to her face.

Using your thumb to remove the tears and take any strands away.

Her lips meet yours; you stay still for a moment but respond. “Make me forget”, she whispers to your lips. “Make me forget their monastery and dirty words”.

You only response by brushing your lips together.

“Lady Sans-”, Shae stops midway. You pull away from Sansa covering your bare chest as she freezes like a deer at headlights. Shae lips turn up-smiling as if she’s in relief. “I’ll leave you to it”, Shae walks away closing the door behind her.

Lights flash on the run for the fences

Let them say what they want, we won’t hear it

Lose sleep, swing ship, all the damn time, not this time

You stood close to a man named Oberyn Martell.

He and his wife didn’t lose the chance flirting with you. She ran her fingers up your arm; “Your way of acting seems as if…you enjoy it”, your fingers hold hers only to move it away. “Are you with someone?” You didn’t respond close to choking on air. “N-no”, Oberyn caught your hesitation, “Forbidden isn’t it?”

Your eyes land on Sansa who returns your gaze; Oberyn smirks. You are an idiot-you just revealed your affair to Sansa. Oberyn simply pats your shoulder and leaves you to it. You glance at Sansa to notice her still gazing at you-you only offered her a smile. Sansa doesn’t return the gesture making you frown but you realized it could raise suspicions.

Just grab my hand and don’t ever drop it

My love, they are the hunters, we are the foxes

And we run

Baby I know places we won’t be found and they’ll be

Chasing their tails tryin’ to track us down

Cause I, I know places we can hide, I know places

Joffrey must have been the biggest fool to ever exist.

One minute he announces the wedding is a serious event the next he brings a show filled with dwarves acting as kings.

What did Joffrey enjoy when doing this to Sansa? Pleasure? Power?

Sansa didn’t show a slight emotion but everything could be seen through her eyes.

Many laughed and a man gagged on his drink; slamming his fists on the table next to you. Out of disgust you sneered at the man but reminded yourself not to cause any trouble. You wished for Sansa and your eyes to meet but it’s as if she’s frozen-not functioning. Joffrey was howling with laughter-you didn’t miss the look Margaery’s face once he turned his back on her.

It all happened in a moment; Tyrion was being humiliated and the next thing Joffrey’s holding for breath. The kings-guard Jaime runs to Joffrey so does his mother.

Your eyes widen when a man comes from behind Sansa; her look tells you everything.

He pulls her away and you notice her urge to stay to call out for you. “Sansa”, you mutter to yourself-calling out for her hoping she would hear you.

Without a second though you sprint to her direction. Everyone’s too busy or simply shocked to notice any other movement. Just the fact their king was poisoned.

“Sansa!”

You gasp for air; your dress was torn. Mud and dirt were to be seen-your hair is untamed. Sansa breathed, she smiles with nearly tears.

“We need to leave” “Not without her”, The man takes a look at you and gives you a motion.

You get into the boat with Sansa as your arms intertwined with another.As soon as you reach the ship-you were welcomed into a room. You scowled when you see Petyr Baelish other known as Littlefinger approaching you both. So it was him who did it, his idea. “Don’t trust him”, you mumble to Sansa.

They are the hunters, we are the foxes

And we run

Just grab my hand and don’t ever drop it

My love

You enter the room after a ‘come in’ to see Sansa in all her glory bathing. “Your aunt seems like-” “Like she hates me”, you shrug and nod at the same time. “She hates my mother”, Her voice sounds bitter. Sansa scrubs her arms a bit too rough, you interrupted her. Taking the cloth from her you gently rub the cloth across her arms to her shoulder.

Sansa remains silent for a while.

“Will you join me?” You were mildly surprised at her invitation. “Pardon me”, Sansa quickly denies but you stop her by standing tall to undress yourself. You join her and sigh in bliss when the hot water welcomes your body. It’s as if the world that rested on your shoulders weren’t as heavy.

Sansa comes to your open arms; resting her forehead to your shoulder.

She didn’t say anything for the rest of the evening-it was just silence.

Baby I know places we won’t be found and they’ll be

Chasing their tails tryin’ to track us down

Cause I, I know places we can hide, I know places

I know places

You stood affront of her, trying not shed any tears. She was horrified all the facade she held was gone.

Your hair was cut short, only wearing a an old dress that was rag and torn, your eyes were swollen with bags under it.

“Come serve me a drink”, Ramsay demands. With shaking hands you pour him a drink, “The same to my lovely wife”, the sarcasm is noted but you obliged refusing to look at her.

After this you walk Sansa to her room while Ramsay goes hunting for ‘animals’. “Y/N?” Sansa seeks for you, not for you to answer but wishing that you still had your name.

Your eyes refused to look at hers, you could feel her voice starting to quiver and shake.

“Please don’t leave…please”, she pleads for you. When you didn’t answer-she wraps her arm around you sobbing. Your hands slowly reach up to rest on her back.

Sansa and you separate; you try your best to smile but it ends up being crooked.

Sansa sobs start to become heavy. You weren’t gone yet. You were still here. You were still Y/N. You’re still with her.

Ramsay will pay-Sansa thought and he will be shown no mercy.

You get into the boat with Sansa as your arms intertwined with another.As soon as you reach the ship-you were welcomed into a room. You scowled when you see Petyr Baelish other known as Littlefinger approaching you both. So it was him who did it, his idea. “Don’t trust him”, you mumble to Sansa.

They are the hunters, we are the foxes

And we run

Just grab my hand and don’t ever drop it

My love

You enter the room after a ‘come in’ to see Sansa in all her glory bathing. “Your aunt seems like-” “Like she hates me”, you shrug and nod at the same time. “She hates my mother”, Her voice sounds bitter. Sansa scrubs her arms a bit too rough, you interrupted her. Taking the cloth from her you gently rub the cloth across her arms to her shoulder.

Sansa remains silent for a while.

“Will you join me?” You were mildly surprised at her invitation. “Pardon me”, Sansa quickly denies but you stop her by standing tall to undress yourself. You join her and sigh in bliss when the hot water welcomes your body. It’s as if the world that rested on your shoulders weren’t as heavy.

Sansa comes to your open arms; resting her forehead to your shoulder.

She didn’t say anything for the rest of the evening-it was just silence.

Baby I know places we won’t be found and they’ll be

Chasing their tails tryin’ to track us down

Cause I, I know places we can hide, I know places

I know places

You stood affront of her, trying not shed any tears. She was horrified all the facade she held was gone.

Your hair was cut short, only wearing a an old dress that was rag and torn, your eyes were swollen with bags under it.

“Come serve me a drink”, Ramsay demands. With shaking hands you pour him a drink, “The same to my lovely wife”, the sarcasm is noted but you obliged refusing to look at her.

After this you walk Sansa to her room while Ramsay goes hunting for ‘animals’. “Y/N?” Sansa seeks for you, not for you to answer but wishing that you still had your name.

Your eyes refused to look at hers, you could feel her voice starting to quiver and shake.

“Please don’t leave…please”, she pleads for you. When you didn’t answer-she wraps her arm around you sobbing. Your hands slowly reach up to rest on her back.

Sansa and you separate; you try your best to smile but it ends up being crooked.

Sansa sobs start to become heavy. You weren’t gone yet. You were still here. You were still Y/N. You’re still with her.

Ramsay will pay-Sansa thought and he will be shown no mercy.
trail.content:
You stand with a hand on my waistline

Good to see that we’re out in blank side

I can hear them whisper as we pass by

It’s a bad sign, bad sign

Sansa and you held one another while you walk among the crowd.

“Ignore them Sansa”, her body shakes. You feel her grip tightens as a group of women whisper from beside. “Lady Stark will be married to the imp”, one of the ladies spoke in a low voice. Sansa held her head high but you had yours down.

You went up the stairs away from the garden and the people.

Walking through for her to say her prayers.  

Something happens when everybody finds out

See the vulture circling in dark cloud

Love’s a fragile little flame, it could burn out

It could burn out

Cause they got the cages, they got the boxes

And guns, they are the hunters, we are the foxes

And we run

“You seem quite close to lady Stark”, you were midway drinking the wine but settled the cup on the table.

Tyrion Lannister; there he stands. A man who came from the family that raged war to your lady’s. The man who she married and will have the purpose to birth his child. You hated the Lannisters but Tyrion wasn’t easily hated however you didn’t like him either. A dwarf he is-meaning that he’s been ashamed for it his whole life maybe that’s why you don’t hate him as much.

You stand up in a hurry.

“My lord”, you bow to him but Tyrion gives a smile and dismisses it. You sit down-nervous on why he wants to talk to you. “You haven’t answered my question”, you frown slightly.

“What question? You haven’t asked one”. You cringe at the way you sounded and slightly afraid of what he’ll say but Tyrion doesn’t show any slight of annoyance just amusement. “Your relation with Sansa”, you’re tense and on the edge. Tyrion seems to sense something but maybe it just you being anxious as always.

“I have been her handmaiden for a long time”, Tyrion takes a seat next to you. You sigh thinking that you are stuck having to hold a conversation. Tyrion hands a motion for the servant to get him a drink. “Why are you here my lord?” Tyrion fidgets his fingers; “I was wondering if I could earn her trust…in a way”.

Raising your brow at his question to say you’re surprised. Tyrion’s drink is received as you sit up. You gulp your drink then answered him, “Sansa…used to like a lot of things that girls..her age would”. Tyrion nods in acknowledgment having an ear, “Does she still likes them?”

You coughed a laugh, “She did until Joffrey came around”. It took you a moment to become aware of what you said. “I’m sorry sir! I didn’t mean to insult the king or…”. Tyrion dismisses it with a hand, “Joffrey has known to destroy everything he touches”. Your body relaxes-Tyrion isn’t so bad like he seems but you had your guards up but.

Tyrion wasn’t as bad that’s something you would have to admit, In fact you enjoy his company.

People were judging you because you laughed loudly. Tyrion tells another story of him and his whores while you drank. “And then I vomited all over her”, the wine spits out of your mouth. Tyrion slightly backs away but laughs and you did the same.

Leveling your hand to your chin to catch any wine that spilled-Tyrion grabs you a cloth which you wiped with.

Sansa comes storming over, it seems she had a chance of meeting Joffrey along the way. “I want to leave”. Obvious to everyone she seems distressed and close to tears. You stand up, saying goodbye to Tyrion who wishes you a good day.

Baby I know places we won’t be found and they’ll be

Chasing their tails tryin’ to track us down

Cause I, I know places we can hide, I know places

I know places

Walking to her chamber; she rushes in the room. Sansa lets herself fall to to the bed and sobs.

You close the door approaching the bed and laying next to her.

“Sansa”, you call out for her in a low voice. She responds by burying her head on your shoulder.

“Was it Joffrey?” She shakes her head; “It’s everyone”. Her head rises-you see the tears sticking to her face; some of her hair strands glued to her face.

Using your thumb to remove the tears and take any strands away.

Her lips meet yours; you stay still for a moment but respond. “Make me forget”, she whispers to your lips. “Make me forget their monastery and dirty words”.

You only response by brushing your lips together.

“Lady Sans-”, Shae stops midway. You pull away from Sansa covering your bare chest as she freezes like a deer at headlights. Shae lips turn up-smiling as if she’s in relief. “I’ll leave you to it”, Shae walks away closing the door behind her.

Lights flash on the run for the fences

Let them say what they want, we won’t hear it

Lose sleep, swing ship, all the damn time, not this time

You stood close to a man named Oberyn Martell.

He and his wife didn’t lose the chance flirting with you. She ran her fingers up your arm; “Your way of acting seems as if…you enjoy it”, your fingers hold hers only to move it away. “Are you with someone?” You didn’t respond close to choking on air. “N-no”, Oberyn caught your hesitation, “Forbidden isn’t it?”

Your eyes land on Sansa who returns your gaze; Oberyn smirks. You are an idiot-you just revealed your affair to Sansa. Oberyn simply pats your shoulder and leaves you to it. You glance at Sansa to notice her still gazing at you-you only offered her a smile. Sansa doesn’t return the gesture making you frown but you realized it could raise suspicions.

Just grab my hand and don’t ever drop it

My love, they are the hunters, we are the foxes

And we run

Baby I know places we won’t be found and they’ll be

Chasing their tails tryin’ to track us down

Cause I, I know places we can hide, I know places

Joffrey must have been the biggest fool to ever exist.

One minute he announces the wedding is a serious event the next he brings a show filled with dwarves acting as kings.

What did Joffrey enjoy when doing this to Sansa? Pleasure? Power?

Sansa didn’t show a slight emotion but everything could be seen through her eyes.

Many laughed and a man gagged on his drink; slamming his fists on the table next to you. Out of disgust you sneered at the man but reminded yourself not to cause any trouble. You wished for Sansa and your eyes to meet but it’s as if she’s frozen-not functioning. Joffrey was howling with laughter-you didn’t miss the look Margaery’s face once he turned his back on her.

It all happened in a moment; Tyrion was being humiliated and the next thing Joffrey’s holding for breath. The kings-guard Jaime runs to Joffrey so does his mother.

Your eyes widen when a man comes from behind Sansa; her look tells you everything.

He pulls her away and you notice her urge to stay to call out for you. “Sansa”, you mutter to yourself-calling out for her hoping she would hear you.

Without a second though you sprint to her direction. Everyone’s too busy or simply shocked to notice any other movement. Just the fact their king was poisoned.

“Sansa!”

You gasp for air; your dress was torn. Mud and dirt were to be seen-your hair is untamed. Sansa breathed, she smiles with nearly tears.

summary: I always read these amazing sansan stories and I wonder what you think his and her small clothes actually look like? What time...
question: I always read these amazing sansan stories and I wonder what you think his and her small clothes actually look like? What time period would GOT small clothes fall under?
answer:
I don’t honestly know what time period their clothing would fall into, my best guess is Victorian based on other period movies. However, I can recommend this very interesting meta about ASOIAF clothing by @justadram . Perhaps @nobodysuspectsthebutterfly could offer more information on that as well.

That being said, I definitely have plenty of non-historically accurate head canons about Sansa and Sandor’s undergarments - is that weird?

Sandor, of course, wears no smallclothes. Ever. They cut and chafe his incredibly muscular thighs, enormous manhood and tight, round ass. And besides, Sandor cannot possibly fit into smallclothes while he’s wearing his skin-tight, fits like a leather glove leather breeches. He doesn’t even wear smallclothes to bed because he sleeps completely nude and is too warm - or he has company and doesn’t want anything between him and his little bird. 

*fans self* 

Ahem, as for Sansa, of course, is a highborn lady, and being a lady means wearing all of the necessary garments for her time period. She would wear very intricate, beautiful chemises, corsets, smallclothes and stockings. 

I imagine she would wear undergarments similar to these in the south:

In the north, she would probably wear finely knitted, wool chemises, embroidered wollen stockings and thick silk and wool underskirts with extra layers for warmth.

At night, she wears only a thin silken shift under layers of furs in the north, wrapped in Sandor’s arms. In the south, she’s given up on wearing bedgowns because Sandor only tears them off of her the moment she climbs into bed, jealously wanting nothing between their skins.

summary: We are due a third “secret wedding” in the show
title: We are due a third “secret wedding” in the show
body:
We had the first “secret wedding” (timeline wise)  between Rhaegar Targaryen and Lyanna Stark that tore apart the 7 Kingdoms…

and we had a second “secret wedding” between Robb Stark and Talisa Maegyr/Jeyne Westerling that brought death and destruction on House Stark and the North (aka the Red Wedding)

Since GRRM (and D&D) loves doing things in three…here’s hoping a third “secret wedding” between Jon and Sansa will unify the 7 Kingdoms, bring peace and prosperity and maybe for the first time have two Northerners rule Westeros.

Maybe we could see a “secret wedding” with Bran, Arya, Brienne, and Samwell as the witness, may be at the Winterfell godswood, before things Winterfell gets destroyed and then after they have taken the Iron Throne and delivered Westeros from the clutches of Daenerys and Cersei, another public wedding at King’s Landing/Dragonpit. This would parallel Jaehaerys and Alysanne’s two marriages as well.

summary: You know, I've kept coming across these arguments about Sansa calling Jon bastard out of spite and them having a negative...
question: You know, I've kept coming across these arguments about Sansa calling Jon bastard out of spite and them having a negative relationship, as well as Sansa allegedly calling Arya "Horseface" and I'm like...where? Jeyne called Arya that, not Sansa. Arya even explicitly states it was Jeyne. Yet Sansa gets blamed? And Sansa never called Jon a bastard to his face, nor do I recall her ever being cruel when it is mentioned. Jon even said himself that Sansa has always called him "half-brother."
answer:
Sansa the Oppressor is one of my least favourite things alongside Sansa the Chambermaid and Sansa the Traitor. It requires people to ignore canon or the context of the quotes that keep getting passed around (I remember one asshole who pretends to be a Sansa fan making a post of quotes from Sansa III in AGoT and adding the few Arya quotes in which she’s not calling Sansa stupid). Sansa called Jon a bastard to explain his jealousy towards Joffrey and she was right. Not only that but bastard has been used as a reference to Jon in his siblings’ POV and you don’t see people writing posts about how they were Jon’s abusers. I think Sansa and Jon had a distant relationship with one another and in which they barely interacted and when they did they were polite to each other. If Sansa was rubbing mud on Jon’s face and telling him he was no good, then Jon should have had a flashback like the one he had about Robb calling him a bastard but he didn’t. He thinks of Sansa fondly.

As for Arya, that argument is so boring to me. Theon mentions that he remembered a nickname Jeyne and Sansa had for Arya but we have no instance of Sansa thinking or using it in either her chapters or Arya’s. Sansa’s usual reaction to Arya when they’re having an argument is a type of silent treatment where she’d ignore her and reply curtly once in a while. The only exception was in Sansa III when Sansa was reminded of the Trident incident where her direwolf was killed and she explodes in anger especially when Ned tells her that the betrothal was broken. As for Sansa not caring about Arya, I really don’t see the problem. Not only does she try not to think of family members, she also never had a good relationship with Arya. Sometimes family members don’t like each other. You don’t see me forming at the mouth whenever Arya is dismissive of Sansa. Arya doesn’t like Sansa, that’s OK with me.

If Sansa was rubbing mud on Jon’s face and telling him he was no good, then Jon should have had a flashback like the one he had about Robb calling him a bastard but he didn’t. He thinks of Sansa fondly.

As for Arya, that argument is so boring to me. Theon mentions that he remembered a nickname Jeyne and Sansa had for Arya but we have no instance of Sansa thinking or using it in either her chapters or Arya’s. Sansa’s usual reaction to Arya when they’re having an argument is a type of silent treatment where she’d ignore her and reply curtly once in a while. The only exception was in Sansa III when Sansa was reminded of the Trident incident where her direwolf was killed and she explodes in anger especially when Ned tells her that the betrothal was broken. As for Sansa not caring about Arya, I really don’t see the problem. Not only does she try not to think of family members, she also never had a good relationship with Arya. Sometimes family members don’t like each other. You don’t see me forming at the mouth whenever Arya is dismissive of Sansa. Arya doesn’t like Sansa, that’s OK with me.

summary: i was reading your many man many anti jon posts and i disagree with a lot of them. i do love sansa but she did undermine jon as...
question: i was reading your many man many anti jon posts and i disagree with a lot of them. i do love sansa but she did undermine jon as much as she could
answer:
Listen if Sansa was full on undermining Jon and wanting the throne for herself, I’d love it because 1) she is a trueborn child of Ned 2) she won the battle 3) I don’t see why she needs to be extremely loyal and supportive of Jon. The problem with your claim is that we got a Sansa who is both loyal to Jon and who expresses opinions that Jon doesn’t agree with. That’s it! Sansa is so benign towards Jon that I have a strong urge to see things from POV of people who hate her because it really doesn’t make any sense.

Jon becomes king taking credit for something Sansa did, Sansa makes no complaint. In fact two different factions offer Sansa the crown and she rejects both. Sansa of course didn’t trust Littlefinger but when the North offered her queenship, it would have made a lot of sense for Sansa to take since their king was a hostage but she didn’t which is apparently a crime to people like you.

As for calling out Jon’s decisions, Jon made them on his own and then told everyone. Sansa wasn’t the only one who objected and she didn’t object for no good reason. Jon was failing to reward supporters which came back to bite him like 3 episodes later. Then Jon started bitching at Sansa (and Sansa alone) for daring to question him publicly. He didn’t take into account that he was making the decision right there and then and that it wouldn’t make sense for him to take it back later should Sansa or the lords convince him to so she really only had that meeting to speak up. The second time Jon made a spontaneous decision (one he had a perfect opportunity to speak to Sansa about- you know when he got Tyrion’s letter), he decided, despite being a fucking king, he’ll go to Daenerys with a handful of men. Sansa told him to be reasonable and send emissaries because Targaryens have a violent history, they didn’t know Daenerys and Tyrion subtly threatened them in his letter. Sansa relenting when Jon named her regent isn’t side eye worthy at all because it was obvious by then he had made his mind up.

People like you and other antis have a very different moral standard for Sansa that shifts and changes so that even when she does what you want, you crucify her for not doing it enough or you find a different reason all together.

summary:
Sansa, answering the phone: Hello?

Arya: I can't take out the trash today. I'm working late.

Sansa: The caller id says you're...
body:
Sansa, answering the phone: Hello?

Arya: I can’t take out the trash today. I’m working late.

Sansa: The caller id says you’re calling from the kitchen. In fact, I can see you.

Arya, edges sideways: Okay, can you see me now?

Sansa: …no.

Arya: Now I’m at work.

summary: Ongoing ...it will never match the rising sun. It is the end of the world, and due to magic and plot, Sansa's consciousness is...
caption:
Ongoing

…it will never match the rising sun.

It is the end of the world, and due to magic and plot, Sansa’s consciousness is permanently transported into the past; into Cersei’s body immediately before she meets King Robert in the Sept of Baelor.

How does Sansa, as Cersei, change the realm for better or for worse politically and personally as Queen? How does Sansa, as Cersei, deal with being married to Robert? And how on earth does Sansa, as Cersei, deal with being Tywin’s daughter, Tyrion’s hated sister, and Jaime’s beloved?

summary:
Chapter 24 | Lutefisk and Lefse
        |
        Archive of Our Own
title:
Chapter 24 | Lutefisk and Lefse
        |
        Archive of Our Own
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Sansa had given Sandor a rundown of the evening events; hockey was played until dusk, then they came in for showers and supper. Catelyn served them, they ate, helped clean up, and then were allowed to open gifts from aunts and uncles, as well as grandparents.

“They only ever send us money anyways,” Arya hissed to Sandor as they sat in the living room with their cards.

“Lysa doesn’t even bother anymore,” Sansa whispered, as Talisa opened the tie-dye onesie Osha had sent for Alek.

“But god forbid Cat and dad not get anything for her kid,” Jon muttered from behind them. Catelyn glanced their way and they all made a big show of pretending to be tucking their money into their wallets, or intently reading the short card from their grandparents.

After presents came midnight mass; the house briefly erupted into intense chaos as they all tried to get ready at once. Talisa and Robb had a quiet but furious disagreement over if Alek was going to church. It ended when Robb reminded her that her parents’ flight was delayed and that they had nothing else to wait for. Sansa felt that though he won the argument, it might have been in his marriage’s best interest that he hadn’t.

Finally they were squeezing into cars, the drivers and nursing mother glaring at the others passed around a thermos of coffee and rum whenever Catelyn couldn’t see it. Sansa intercepted it when Jon tried to pass it to Rickon, grinning. She punched Jon in the arm and slid it to Arya, then patted Sandor’s knee and smoothed out the cashmere dress she’d chosen. Sandor looked handsome in his black slacks and the deep red sweater he’d let her pick. It was his one concession to the holiday spirit.
